data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You only return to the starting point if the correct sequence is followed. If you follow this sequence, you always face forward and then take 9 steps left. When you face forward, you have no choice but to take 10 steps forward. While you face to the left when facing to the right, you have no choice but to take 9 steps left. When you face to the right when facing to the left, you have no choice but to take 9 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps to return to where you started. You cannot turn around and turn right at the same time. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Each of the steps have a back up to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It would return to the starting point if you continue down and take 7 more steps. So, the answer is yes.

To return to the starting point, you would take 10 steps to do one of the following: Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around and turn around. You would need to take 10 steps to get from one starting point to the other. So, the answer is yes.

Once you've got around the corner, you're in the start point. So, the answer is yes.

You can' t turn right, you have to turn left to go back the other way. So, the answer is No.

Turning around take 8 steps and returning to starting point take 2 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instruction to always face forward is in the order in which you should move your body. If you take 4 steps forward (forward towards the person in front of you), you are 4 steps back. Likewise, if you take 6 steps forward (forward towards the person in front of you), you are 6 steps back. So, the answer is No.

If you go back to your starting point after turning around you’ve taken 9 steps. Turning around you have taken 2 steps. Leaving you has taken 7 steps. It’s infcuding to say Take 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If the person is facing forward, it should always be done before taking a step backward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always face forward in a sequence. If you take 6 steps backward, take those 6 steps to the left and take 6 steps backward to go to the right of it. The sequence moves backward in 2 steps. If you are looking left to go back in 3 steps, your turn is to the right. The sequence from 2 step backward to 2 steps left contains a series of 2 steps. This is the same sequence as in the first pattern. The instructions tell us to start at an upright position and end in a sequence of different steps. This sequence also specifies how we go in 4 steps. Since we begin the sequence in the order in which we start, this sequence is the same as starting at a starting position. Thus, the answer is No.

If you' reversing the direction we are facing, you are always facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

When you take 3 steps forward, you’ll be walking in a direction – not facing forward. In 2 steps, you will be going in a direction – not facing right. You’ll also need to take 4 steps left, which is towards a right angle of 45 degrees. So, the answer is yes.

There are 3 steps on the right and you would start with 3 steps right. In this order: Once you have done 6 steps left there are 3 steps left and that number will become 6. In this order you would take 3 steps right and that number will become 7. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If the starting point is always facing forward then if you are always facing left then you can return to start with face forward. To return to the starting point with face forward would require face forward with 7 steps taken. On the other hand, if you are always facing backward then if you are always facing down then you can return to start with facing down. Taking 4 steps left and taking four steps left with 7 steps taken left and 8 steps taken right to go backward would put you back at start with face forward with 4 steps taken left. Thus, the answer is yes.
